item.title: Singapore is implementing measures to ensure that esports becomes a profitable industry
item.description:
Source: SCOGA. From left: Matthias Beyer, Partnerships Lead, Southeast Asia at Twitch, Dennis Ooi, Honorary Secretary of (Singapore) Cybersports & Online Gaming Association (SCOGA), Kelvin Tan, President and Co-Founder of SCOGA, Nicholas Khoo, Chairman and Co-Founder of SCOGA, Raiford Cockfield III, Director of APAC Partnerships at Twitch, and Dr Charles Ling, COO, Informatics Education. As esports’ popularity explodes globally, the (Singapore) Cybersports & Online Gaming Association (SCOGA) has established new partnerships to cultivate Singapore’s esports landscape...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/singapore-is-implementing-measures-to-ensure-that-esports-becomes-a-profitable-industry/

item.title: Singtel has declared the champions of Season 1 for the PVP Esports Corporate Championship
item.description:
Teams from Singapore and Indonesia emerged victorious in the corporate category of Singtel’s 2020 PVP Esports Community Championships (Season 1). Deloitte’s team, DeloitteOne, and DBS’s team, TurretHeist, secured the top spots in the Dota 2 and Mobile Legends: Bang Bang Corporate Championships, respectively. The Indonesian team, HZL Legion (RM Djamiah Putra), claimed victory in PlayerUnknown’s Battlegrounds (PUBG): Mobile. Each winning team received over S$5,000 in cash and prizes. The grand finals, held online from September 5th to 6th due to the COVID-19 pandemic, saw teams competing remotely...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/singtel-has-declared-the-champions-of-season-1-for-the-pvp-esports-corporate-championship/
